DOC.brief_summary: To ascertain whether there are fewer adhesions (internal scars) formed following laparoscopic (key-hole) surgery for colorectal diseases than traditional open surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Adhesion Formation Following Laparoscopic and Open Colorectal Surgery
DOC.criteria: Previous elective colonic or rectal resection Having a further operative intervention at which time a laparoscopy can be performed Children <18 Further surgery not relating to the primary colorectal surgery
